lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/chatbot.evan.Evan.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run chatbot.evan.Evan.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* main method of the Main class Evan chatbot
* Continuously takes in user input and gives an appropriate response until the user enters "bye
reply.printDialog("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Class for Deadline command with its static implementation of its processes
* Prompts user to enter the task and deadline date and time before validating and adding it to the list.
reply.printDialog("So you want to add a task with deadline. Tell me what's the task.");
reply.printDialog("Indicate a start time in ranging from 0000 - 2359. You may enter 'Skip' to not indicate a time");
reply.printDialog("Non-numerical characters detected. Please enter numbers only. Returning to homepage...");
* Class for Delete command with its static implementation of its processes
* Validates the input after the delete keyword in the string. Deletes the task if it's a vlid input.
* @param input String input containing the command and its arguments
* @throws InvalidInputException if the arguments after command is invalid
* @throws MissingArgumentException if the arguments after the command is missing
* @throws InvalidCommandException if the command in the string is invalid
public static void start(String input) throws
reply.printDialog(" Index number does not exist in our list");
* Class for Event command with its static implementation of its processes
* Prompts user to enter the task, start and end date/time before validating and adding it to the list.
reply.printDialog("So you want to add a event task. Tell me what's the task.");
reply.printDialog("Indicate a start time in ranging from 0000 - 2359. You may enter 'Skip' to not indicate a time");
reply.printDialog("Non-numerical characters detected. Please enter numbers only. Returning to homepage...");
reply.printDialog("Indicate a start time in ranging from 0000 - 2359. You may enter 'Skip' to not indicate a time");
reply.printDialog("Non-numerical characters detected. Please enter numbers only. Returning to homepage...");
* Class for Fnd command with its static implementation of its processes
* Validates the input after the find keyword in the string and finds the task
* @param input String input containing the command and its arguments
* @throws MissingArgumentException if the arguments after the command is missing
* @throws InvalidCommandException if the command in the string is invalid
* @throws InvalidInputException if there is more than one keyword in the input
public static void start(String input) throws
* Class for Mark command with its static implementation of its processes
* Validates the input after the mark keyword in the string. Marks the task if it's a valid input.
* @param input String input containing the command and its arguments
* @throws MissingArgumentException if the arguments after the command is missing
* @throws InvalidCommandException if the command in the string is invalid
public static void start(String input) throws
reply.printDialog("Index number does not exist in our list");
* Class for Todo command with its static implementation of its processes
* Prompts user to enter the task name before adding it to the list.
reply.printDialog("So you want to add a ToDo task. Tell me what's the task.");
* Class for Unmark command with its static implementation of its processes
* Validates the input after the unmark keyword in the string. Unmarks the task if it's a valid input.
* @param input String input containing the command and its arguments
* @throws InvalidInputException if the arguments after command is invalid
* @throws MissingArgumentException if the arguments after the command is missing
* @throws InvalidCommandException if the command in the string is invalid
public static void start(String input) throws
reply.printDialog("Index number does not exist in our list");
* Enum class with all the commands listed
* returns the String representation of the command
* returns the string length of the command
* Checked Exception for the event where the input command is not a valid command.
* Returns a string to inform users that the command is invalid
* @return string information to inform user of exception
return "This is not a registered command that I know of";
* Checked Exception for the event where the input date is not a valid date.
* Returns a string to inform users that the date is invalid
* @return string information to inform user of exception
return "The given date is invalid. Returning to homepage...";
* Checked Exception for the event where the input is not valid.
* Returns a string to inform users that the input is invalid
* @return string information to inform user of exception
return "Your given input is invalid. Returning to homepage...";
* Checked Exception for the event where the input time is not a valid time.
* Returns a string to inform users that the time is invalid
* @return string information to inform user of exception
return "The given date is invalid. Returning to homepage...";
* Exception for the event where user input has missing arguments.
* @param missingArgument a string depicting arguments that are missing from user input
* Returns a string to inform users of the exception
* @return string information to inform user of exception
return "the following information is missing: " + missingArgument;
* Class to help parse complex strings from user input
* Validates if the first word is a valid command and filters it to return the arguments
* @param input string of a single user input
* @throws MissingArgumentException if there are no arguments
* @throws InvalidCommandException if the first word is an invalid command
public static String getCommandArguments(String input) throws
* Takes in a string of input and returns the first word
* @return the first word of the string
* Class for the parsing of a string of date/time data
* Takes in a string containing the date and attempts to find a format that the date is written in
* @param date string of the date data
* @return DateTimeFormatter containing the corresponding date format
* @throws InvalidDateException if no appropriate date format is found
private static DateTimeFormatter findDateFormat(String date) throws InvalidDateException {
* Checks if the date string has the same date format in the formatter
* @param date string of the date data
* @param formatter date format to be checked with
* @return boolean indicating if its the same format or not
private static boolean hasSameDateFormat(String date, DateTimeFormatter formatter) {
* Takes in a string containing date, validates if its a valid date and then returns the date in a standardized format
* @param date string containign the user input date
* @return date string in a standardised format
* @throws InvalidDateException if date is an invalid date
public static String formatDate(String date) throws InvalidDateException {
* Takes in a string containing time, validates if its a valid time and then returns the date/time in a standardized format
* @param date string date input by user
* @param time string time input by user
* @return date and time string in standardised format
* @throws InvalidTimeException if input time is not a valid time
* @throws InvalidDateException if date is not a valid date
public static String formatTime(String date, String time) throws InvalidTimeException, InvalidDateException {

* Object class for instances of todo tasks

* abstract declaration of a method to format properties of the todo task
* @return String of formatted data of the instance
* Class for chatbot to create standardised replies with ui
+ indent + "Hello! I'm chatbot.evan.Evan, your personal task planning assistant\n"
+ indent + "What can I do for you?\n\n"
+ indent + "todo: create a new todo task\n"
+ indent + "deadline: create a new deadline task\n"
+ indent + "event: create a new event task\n"
+ indent + "mark: mark a task as complete\n"
+ indent + "unmark: mark a task as incomplete\n"
+ indent + "delete: delete a task from the list\n"
* factory method to enforce one instance of the reply class
* Takes in a dialog and prints it our in a standardised ui format
* @param dialog dialog of the chatbot reply
private final ByteArrayOutputStream outContent = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
private final ByteArrayOutputStream errContent = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
event task /by with wrong argument /to to
event task /from without from and to but uses /by
